page.title: 17WATH BY-PASS
page.content: Wath{by-pass}is being built to cut down the traffic in the town centre, especially around the Montgomery roundabout. It is being built at the north of the town on the site of an old disused canal. The cost will be around 1.2 million pounds. The road is approx. 1.2 km. long and is 7.3 metres wide. The actual depth of the road is 850 cm., this is made up of 550m.m. of limestone and 300m.m. of bitumen. Because it was built on the old canal, some of the ground was very boggy - so a rock blanket foundation had to be laid. Several properties had to be knocked down for the new road, and an old bridge over the canal, which is now the sight of a new roundabout.
